text: The arrondissement of Marmande is an arrondissement of France. It is part of the Lot-et-Garonne département in the Nouvelle-Aquitaine region. Its capital, and subpréfecture of the department, is the city of Marmande. ==History== When the Lot-et-Garonne department was created on 17 February 1800, the arrondissement of Marmande was part of that original department. ==Geography== The arrondissement of Marmande has an area of . It has 83,245 inhabitants and a population density of inhabitants/km². The arrondissement is in the northwest of Lot-et-Garonne and is bordered to the north by the Dordogne department, to the east by the arrondissement of Villeneuve-sur-Lot, to the southeast by the arrondissement of Agen, to the south by the arrondissement of Nérac and to the west by the Gironde department. ==Composition== ===Cantons=== After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, cantons are not subdivisions of the arrondissements so they could have communes that belong to different arrondissements. In the arrondissement of Marmande, there are only two cantons where not all their "communes" are in the arrondissement: Les Forêts de Gascogne and Le Val du Dropt. The following table shows the distribution of the "communes" in the cantons and arrondissements: Cantons and communes in the arrondissement of Marmande INSEE Code Canton Arrondissements Total Agen Marmande Villeneuve-sur-Lot Nérac 4707 Les Coteaux de Guyenne 34 34 4708 Les Forêts de Gascogne 16 16 32 4713 Marmande-1 9 + part of Marmande 9 + part of Marmande 4714 Marmande-2 10 + part of Marmande 10 + part of Marmande 4718 Tonneins 13 13 4719 Le Val du Dropt 15 10 25 ===Communes=== The arrondissement of Marmande has 98 communes; they are (with their INSEE codes): #
